title: LADWP

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: LADWP
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

To: Records Custodian
Los Angeles Department of Water and Power (LADWP)
CPRA@ladwp.com

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (CPRA) (California Government Code § 6250 et seq.), I am requesting access to and copies of any and all records related to the functionality, capacity, and vulnerabilities of the fire hydrant system in the Greater Los Angeles area. Specifically, I am seeking information that pertains to the following:
	1.	Hydrant System Vulnerabilities and Capacity:
	•	Reports, memos, studies, assessments, or internal communications related to the fire hydrant system’s operational readiness, capacity, and performance.
	•	Any documented concerns, limitations, or vulnerabilities identified in the fire hydrant system, including but not limited to water pressure issues, dry hydrants, or insufficient flow rates.
	2.	Testing and Evaluations:
	•	Records of any testing, inspections, or evaluations conducted on fire hydrants and related infrastructure.
	•	Results of flow tests, pressure evaluations, or other performance measures specific to fire hydrants in Los Angeles and surrounding areas.
	3.	Awareness of Potential Failures:
	•	Any communications, emails, or reports between LADWP and other government agencies (e.g., Los Angeles Fire Department, City of Los Angeles officials, California State Water Resources Control Board) discussing the fire hydrant systems.
	•	Documents, communications or analyses that acknowledge or outline the risks, concerns and vulneralbiliteis  of the fire hydrant system.
	4.	Mitigation and Preparedness Plans:
	•	Any plans, proposals, or discussions regarding efforts to upgrade or address potential vulnerabilities in the fire hydrant system prior to recent fires.
	•	Funding allocations, budgets, or grants related to improving fire hydrant infrastructure or emergency water systems.

Format of Records:
If possible, I request that the records be provided in electronic format (e.g., PDFs, spreadsheets) and sent via email. Please include any metadata associated with electronic records, such as file creation and modification dates.

Time Frame:
I am requesting records from January 1, 2020, to the present to capture a comprehensive history of planning, testing, and discussions regarding the fire hydrant system.

Fee Waiver Request (If Applicable):
If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me before processing it. I request a fee waiver as this information is in the public interest and contributes to understanding the functionality of critical infrastructure during emergencies.

Under the California Public Records Act (CPRA), Government Code § 6253(c), the Los Angeles Department of Water and Power (LADWP) is required to respond to this request within 10 calendar days of receipt. The response must include:
	1.	Acknowledgment of the Request: Confirmation that the request has been received.
	2.	Determination of Records Availability: A decision regarding whether the requested records exist and can be disclosed.
	3.	Notification of Extension (if applicable): If additional time is needed to locate or compile the requested records, LADWP may extend the response time by an additional 14 calendar days, as permitted by law, provided that you notify me in writing of the reason for the extension.

Should LADWP fail to respond within this statutory timeframe or deny the request without valid legal grounds, it may be considered a violation of the CPRA, and I reserve the right to seek remedies under the law.

Thanks, 
Eric Scharfenberger

title: WA State DOC trans information

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: WA State DOC trans information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The total number of transgender inmates currently in the WA State DOC system. Also let me know how that breaks down between trans women and trans men. I'd like to know what facility you send trans women to, and which one you send trans men to. I'd also like to know how many trans inmates are housed in isolation/solitary confinement vs. some sort of general housing situation. And I would like this breakdown to cover the years 2010-2020. Thank you.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Allen

communications.subject: P-20269
communications.communication:
April 29, 2021


Adam:

I am writing to acknowledge receipt of you public records request sent April 23, 2021.  For future reference, your request has been assigned public records tracking number, P-20269.  You have requested:

1.      The total number of transgender individuals who are currently incarcerated in a DOC facility broken down by "trans men" and "trans women".
2.      What facility DOC houses trans individuals at.
3.      Number of transgender individuals housed in solitary confinement and/or isolation from 2010-2020.

If I have captured any portion of your request incorrectly, please let me know.  A public records request is a request for identifiable public records, where DOC has a record that answers your questions, we will provide it.

Due to a temporary restraining order granted by the Court in Does v. DOC, et al: USDC Cause No. 4:21-cv-05059, the Department will not be producing any records until the Court rules on whether or not to grant a preliminary injunction.

I will follow up with you after the Court's decision regarding the production of any records responsive to your request.

Sincerely,
Denise Vaughan

Denise Vaughan, Information Governance Director
Administrative Operations Division
Department of Corrections
(360) 725-8854 (office)

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: WA State DOC trans information
communications.communication:
Hi Ms Vaughan: Thank you for your quick response. I have to admit to being curious about the court case. When I put in the whole title ("Does v....-05059) I got something in MIssouri. The only other thing I could fin is a recent court case where plaintiffs asked for a mandamus writ to instruct the executive branch to prioritize categories of inmates at high risk for COVID as well as balancing community safety and other release factors they normally take into account. 

You've gotten my request right. Partly I'm asking because even though I've talked to several other trans activists, none of them seem to know where trans men are sent. From what I hear, trans women are usually sent to Monroe CC. But I wonder if it's always been that way? Or if there are plans to do something different in the future. That's part of why I asked for such a long timeframe. 

Thanks,

Adam

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: WA State DOC trans information

I will respond further as soon as the Court has determined what if any records can be released in response to this and other pending requests on this subject matter.

Sincerely,

Denise Vaughan

Denise Vaughan, Information Governance Director
Administrative Operations Division
Department of Corrections
(360) 725-8854 (office)
(360) 810-1130 (cell)

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: WA State DOC trans information
communications.communication:
Hi Ms. Vaughan: I'm confused. Can you clarify something for me please? Is this case and injunction related to inmate files and what information is given out through FOIA? Or is it directly related to trans issues? I can't find it with an internet search. Are you allowed to clarify the subject matter here?

Adam

communications.subject: Public Records Request P-20269
communications.communication:
August 8, 2023


Adam Allen
111440-93925695@requests.muckrock.com


Dear Adam Allen,

I am writing in follow up to previous response sent to you regarding your public records request,
P-20269.  The last response sent to you regarding this request was April 29, 2021, when you were notified of a court order issued that prohibited DOC from providing you the records requested.  There is still an injunction in place that prohibits us from releasing records at this time, however, I am following up to see if you still wish to obtain the records requested or if you would like to alter your request in any way so that we can have responsive records gathered and ready for release when the case is resolved.

If we receive no response from you within 15 days, on or before, August 23, 2023, we will assume you no longer wish to pursue the request and we will consider the request withdrawn.

Sincerely,

Sheila Lawlor
Washington State Department of Corrections
7345 Linderson Way SW
Tumwater, WA 98501



Sheila Lawlor
Information Governance
Records & Information Management
WA State Department of Corrections
sheila.lawlor@doc1.wa.gov<mailto:sheila.lawlor@doc1.wa.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P-20269
communications.communication:
Followup Re: P-20269 information request 
Originally filed: April 23, 2021
Last contact date: August 8, 2023
Re: restraining order status?

Back in 2021, I filed a FOIA request looking for more detailed information on WA DOC and assignment of trans inmates. I found out that there was a court case (Does v. DOC, et al: USDC Cause No. 4:21-cv-05059) with a restraining order prohibiting release of information regarding trans inmates and related issues. So my FOIA request couldn't be fulfilled at that time. Just as a summary, the original request was for:

1. The total number of transgender individuals who are currently incarcerated in a DOC facility broken down by "trans men" and "trans women".
2. What facility DOC houses trans individuals at.
3. Number of transgender individuals housed in solitary confinement and/or isolation from 2010-2020. 

For clarification on number 2, what I'm looking for is any sort of policy or directive, email, or other writing showing a practice of "trans female inmates go to (X) facility, trans male inmates go to (Y) facility". An example, from what I've heard, trans women tend to go to Monroe. But no one seems to know where trans men go. And I'm wondering if that's an unwritten practice that developed over time or policy.

So I thought I'd check in and see if the restraining order has been lifted and that information is now available to be released.
Thank you
Adam Allen

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #P-20269
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Allen,

I received your letter of inquiry regarding the restraining order status:

Follow-up Re: P-20269 information request
Originally filed: April 23, 2021
Last contact date: August 8, 2023


The staff member who has the lead on all requests related to this case is unfortunately out of the office until December 1, however, I have forwarded his email to their office marked for their urgent response.
Thank you,

Sheila Lawlor
Administrative Assistant 2
Records & Information Management
WA State Department of Corrections
sheila.lawlor@doc1.wa.gov<mailto:sheila.lawlor@doc1.wa.gov>

communications.subject: public records request re: transgender  (P-57617)
communications.communication:
Adam Allen,

I acknowledge receipt of your public records request received in our office on December 2, 2025. We have assigned this request a tracking number of P-57617.

You requested the following records:

1. The total number of transgender individuals who are currently incarcerated in a DOC facility broken down by "trans men" and "trans women".
2. What facility DOC houses trans individuals at.
3. Number of transgender individuals housed in solitary confinement and/or isolation from 2010-2020.

For clarification on number 2, what I'm looking for is any sort of policy or directive, email, or other writing showing a practice of "trans female inmates go to (X) facility, trans male inmates go to (Y) facility". An example, from what I've heard, trans women tend to go to Monroe. But no one seems to know where trans men go. And I'm wondering if that's an unwritten practice that developed over time or policy.

Regarding item #2: I believe there are several factors that determine where transgender individuals are housed. I will search for DOC forms, policies, and memos related to housing transgender inmates.

I anticipate providing records to you within 32 business days, on or before January 27, 2026.

Sincerely,

Celeste Ernst, Public Records Specialist
Employee & Business Support Services Administration
Washington State Department of Corrections

communications.subject: public records request re: transgender (P-57617)
communications.communication:
Adam Allen,

This letter is regarding your public records request, tracking # P-57617. There are 133 pages of records identified as being responsive to your request and attached to this email.

These records are provided to you in accordance with the Public Records Act. By making agency documents available to you, the Department is not responsible for your use of the information or for any claims or liabilities that may result from your use or further dissemination.

Your request is now closed. The PRA's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run as of the date of this letter. Please contact me within 30 days if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

Celeste Ernst, Public Records Specialist
Employee & Business Support Services Administration
Washington State Department of Corrections

title: Shang Hassen DOGE CA

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Shang Hassen DOGE CA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all communication Any and all communications between employees of the Bureau of Reclamation's headquarters office and/or employees of its California regional office and any one of the following individuals associated with the Department of Government Efficiency: Tyler Hassen and/or Bryton Shang. This requests seeks records produced  since January 10, 2025. It seeks texts, emails, notes or transcripts of phone calls, notes, transcripts or recordings of Zoom or Microsoft Team meetings, as well as any chats or DMs from Microsoft Teams, Signal or other messaging apps. This request also seeks any calendar entries of meetings between BOR staff and the individuals named above. 

I am a reporter for The Nation magazine and other outlets.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.Sincerely,Jimmy TobiasUpload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fbureau-of-reclamation-8609%252Fshang-hassen-doge-ca-181354%252F%253Femail%253Dbor_foia%252540usbr.gov&url_auth_token=AAAVeHKrFxOUPvZ0IH-uItP4pDY%3A1tiNwi%3ATBqEMR5X2WPeHOKX4FNJYtGJEGblFyoc0HaBzGkZ-Ic 

This message has been sent from an unattended email inbox. For any further correspondence, please contact the bureau at https://www.doi.gov/foia/contacts. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Regards, 
DOI FOIA Office

communications.subject: Re: Clarification for FOIA Request DOI-2025-004034
communications.communication:
Good morning,

I am following up on my previous email. The SOL FOIA Office received your FOIA request, which seeks, "All onboarding records -- including resumes, financial disclosures, position appointment records -- for the following DOI officials: Tyler Hassen, Katrine Trampe, Karen Budd Falen, Laura Rigas, Charles Dankert, and Wynn Radford."

Please clarify what "position appointment records" are, specifically, what types of records are you seeking?

Thanks very much.

Sincerely,
Mai Uyen Le Nguyen
Attorney Advisor
Division of Administration
U.S. Department of Interior
Office of the Solicitor
1849 C Street NW
Washington, DC 20240

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #DOI-2025-004083
communications.communication:
Hi Mai,

Thank you for the note. I am seeking any financial disclosure statements, resumes, ethics waivers or ethics agreements, and any records describing the position to which these individuals are being appointed. Thank you.

Please confirm the receipt of this message. 

Jimmy Tobias

--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Public Records Request – Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS/Drones) Request Number: [Insert Request #, e.g., #L004444-012626] Requester: Chris Martin (MuckRock) 

Dear Mr. Martin, 

The Multnomah County Sheriff’s Office (MCSO) has processed your request for records. 

MCSO has received your payment for this request. Thank you. 

All responsive materials have been successfully uploaded to the GovQA Public Records Portal. 

Please be advised that MCSO does not upload documents directly to third-party websites or external platforms (such as MuckRock). 

To retrieve your documents, please log in to the primary MCSO Public Records Center via GovQA using your credentials. From there, you will be able to download the electronic files in their entirety. 

If you require assistance accessing these documents or encounter any technical difficulties with the portal, please notify our office by replying to this thread. 

As all responsive materials have been provided, this matter is now considered closed. 

Sincerely, 

Public Records Unit Multnomah County Sheriff’s Office

title: Jurisdiction clarification for Lionel Villa Carmona (Washington State Gambling Comission)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Jurisdiction clarification for Lionel Villa Carmona (Washington State Gambling Comission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting clarification of jurisdiction and what parameters are within policy for employee Lionel Villa Carmona (Leonel) to be involved with in regards to Yakima County. 
This individual was present at the scene of an incident in Moxee, WA, dressed in baggy street clothes, and participating in a Search Warrant executed by the Yakima County Sheriff's Department. This individual is seen from the angle of another person's BWC, trying to unlock tiny lock boxes with keys found around the property, additionally tossing about the personal belongings of an entire house, in a reckless, damaging and unprofessional manner, showing little to no regard for preservation and documentation of the items found and seized. He is also seen tampering with a cell phone found on a computer table and reading through personal letters/papers. None of which is permitted via the Search Warrant. 

A ton of time was spent loitering the area, alongside Trevor Herrud from WSP, AND Cole Hecker from Grandview from about 15:00 to 18:40. Lionel left no supplemental narratives of being present at this incident, but was mentioned by one officers narrative report. The aftermath of this Search and Seizure execution is volatile. 

 Lionel Carmona has recently been included in an WSCJTC complaint that is undergoing an investigation with Yakima County Internal Affair's dept, alongside 13 other officers. 

Please let me know if there is additional information I can provide, at your request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Candace B Cupples

communications.subject: GMB Public Records Request #202601-PRR-03
communications.communication:
Dear Candace B Cupples:

The Washington State Gambling Commission (GMB) received your request for records after normal business hours on January 17, 2026. Your request will be processed as a public records request and, as such, this letter responds to your request under RCW 42.56.520 and WAC 230-21. Please refer to the Request ID# identified above when contacting this office about your request.

You asked for copies of the following GMB records:
Requesting clarification of jurisdiction and what parameters are within policy for employee Lionel Villa Carmona (Leonel) to be involved with in regards to Yakima County.

Due to current workloads, the number of other pending requests and the scope of your request, we estimate it could take up to 30 business days to find, review, and copy any available records and, to the extent necessary, notify persons identified in the records under WAC 388-01-140. On or about March 3, 2026, you may anticipate a response from GMB. Records will be produced in installments as appropriate.

GMB has adopted rules pursuant to RCW 42.56.120(2)(b) related to charges for producing records in response to public records requests. GMB may charge for copies of electronic records, actual cost of other copies, and postage (these rules are available at WAC 230-21-016<file://gmbfloly01/records/Templates-Exemptions-FeeCalculator/WAC%20230-21-016>). As of July 1, 2024, GMB will be charging fees in accordance with our fee schedule for all requests that involve more than one installment. A copy of the fee schedule can be found at GMB_Public_Records_Fee_Schedule.pdf (wa.gov)<https://wsgc.wa.gov/sites/default/files/2023-11/GMB_Public_Records_Fee_Schedule.pdf>.

If you have any questions, please contact me.

Sincerely,


[The official logo and seal of the Washington State Gambling Commission, in dark blue on a white background.]
Allyson 'Al' Roberts
Public Records Officer, Legal and Records Unit
Protect the public by ensuring that gambling is legal and honest.
Email:
Web:
allyson.roberts@wsgc.wa.gov<mailto:allyson.roberts@wsgc.wa.gov>
WSGC.wa.gov<http://wsgc.wa.gov/>
PO Box 42400
Olympia, WA 98504-2400

communications.subject: GMB Public Records Request# 202601-PRR-03: Request Complete
communications.communication:
Dear Candace B Cupples:

The Washington State Gambling Commission (GMB) received your request for records after normal business hours on January 17, 2026. Your request will be processed as a public records request and, as such, this letter responds to your request under RCW 42.56.520 and WAC 230-21. Please refer to the Request ID# identified above when contacting this office about your request.

You asked for copies of the following GMB records:
Requesting clarification of jurisdiction and what parameters are within policy for employee Lionel Villa Carmona (Leonel) to be involved with in regards to Yakima County.
Response
The records at the below link are being provided in response to your request and have not been redacted or deleted. Records will be available to download for 30 calendar days from date of this letter.

Link: https://gamblingcommission.box.com/s/fan8lrm3lx4f5m7o42phkaw8lsjzlmkr

This is the last installment of records in response to your request. Your request has been fulfilled by the production of records (including any exemptions claimed) and is now closed. This is our final response. The GMB does not intend to further address the request, and the PRA's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run as of the date of this letter. Please contact me within 30 days by e-mail or at the address below, if you have any questions.

This concludes the GMB's response to your request and the matter is now considered closed.

Anytime a request is "open" and on-going, a Requester can ask a program to review and modify/change a redaction.  This is not considered an appeal, it is considered regular communication related to a request.  See WAC 388-01-130.

If you disagree with this determination or any redactions made during the production of any of the records by GMB Public Records, you may ask for review, by writing to:

               Adam Amorine, Legal Manager
               Washington State Gambling Commission
               PO BOX 42400
               Olympia, WA  98504-2400

If you have any questions, please contact me.

Sincerely,


[The official logo and seal of the Washington State Gambling Commission, in dark blue on a white background.]
Allyson 'Al' Roberts

title: Caring for Caregivers Tax Credit Statistics

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Caring for Caregivers Tax Credit Statistics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information related to the Caring for Caregivers tax credit from as far back as data systems will allow through 2025. Specifically, the following information, as it is available:

1) Number of returns that claimed the credit
2) Total amount of credits claimed ($)
3) If available, (1) and (2) separately by taxpayer characteristics, such as filing status, marital status, age of taxpayer, AGI range, number of dependents, etc.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Caring for Caregivers Tax Credit Statistics
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

You can view all available data for tax credits at this website: State of Oklahoma Tax Credits - Dataset - Oklahoma's Open Data<https://data.ok.gov/dataset/state-of-oklahoma-tax-credits>

You can click on each fiscal year for the excel spreadsheet and do a word search for the tax credit you are seeking information for. Thank you

title: Lake Geneva, Wisconsin Police department reports

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Lake Geneva, Wisconsin Police department reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Police Departments Reports as provided to the Lake Geneva Police and Fire Commission for January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August,September,October, November,and December 2025.
 Reports:
i. Chief's Report
ii. Top Five Monthly Incidents
iii. Monthly Activity Reports
iv. Yearly Activity Reports

Also the minutes for all the meeting of the Lake Geneva Police and Fire Commission for the Year 2025.

thank you,
in advance...

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gary Milliette

title: Exercise Cloudy Office

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Exercise Cloudy Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning, or generated during the development and conduct of Exercise Cloudy Office, a multi-agency exercise hosted by the then-Defense Protective Service and the Office of the Secretary of Defense on May 30, 1998. The exercise was designed to test agencies' ability to respond to a terrorist attack and hostage situation involving chemical weapons. The scope of this request is to prioritize briefing materials provided to participating agencies and any interim and/or final reports or post-mortems written after the exercise concluded.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Military equipment (Las Cruces Police Department)

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Military equipment (Las Cruces Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

An inventory of all military equipment held by the department as of the date of fulfillment of this request. The request includes but is not limited to: 

(1) Unmanned, remotely piloted, powered aerial or ground vehicles.
(2) Mine-resistant ambush-protected (MRAP) vehicles or armored personnel carriers. However, police versions of standard consumer vehicles are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(3) High mobility multipurpose wheeled vehicles (HMMWV), commonly referred to as Humvees, two and one-half-ton trucks, five-ton trucks, or wheeled vehicles that have a breaching or entry apparatus attached. However, unarmored all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) and motorized dirt bikes are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(4) Tracked armored vehicles that provide ballistic protection to their occupants and utilize a tracked system instead of wheels for forward motion.
(5) Command and control vehicles that are either built or modified to facilitate the operational control and direction of public safety units.
(6) Weaponized aircraft, vessels, or vehicles of any kind.
(7) Battering rams, slugs, and breaching apparatuses that are explosive in nature. However, items designed to remove a lock, such as bolt cutters, or a handheld ram designed to be operated by one person, are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(8) Firearms of .50 caliber or greater.
(9) Ammunition of .50 caliber or greater.
(10) Specialized firearms and ammunition of less than .50 caliber, including assault weapons as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code.
(11) Any firearm or firearm accessory that is designed to launch explosive projectiles.
(12) “Flashbang” grenades and explosive breaching tools, “tear gas,” and “pepper balls,” excluding standard, service-issued handheld pepper spray.
(13) Taser Shockwave, microwave weapons, water cannons, and the Long Range Acoustic Device (LRAD).
(14) The following projectile launch platforms and their associated munitions: 40mm projectile launchers, “bean bag,” rubber bullet, and specialty impact munition (SIM) weapons.
(15) Any other military equipment purchased by/for or transferred to the department. 

Requested components of the inventory:
The inventory should include the manufacturer, model number, quantity, initial costs of obtaining the equipment, and estimated annual costs of maintaining the equipment of each type of equipment, where "type" means each item shares the same manufacturer model number. 

The inventory should also specify under which program the equipment was obtained if applicable, including but not limited to the 1033 Program, the 1122 Program, the US Department of Homeland Security Grant Program, US Department of Justice’s Justice Assistant Grant Program, DOJ Equitable Sharing Program, US Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund’s Equitable Sharing Program, and The General Services Administration Federal Surplus Personal Property Donation program.  

I am also requesting a list of all military inventory that has gone missing in 2024 and 2025. 

I am a journalist employed by the news outlet The American Prospect and I am requesting a waiver of all fees. The disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the tools available to the department to maintain safety and order, and protect against attacks from both domestic and outside sources.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Whitney Wimbish

The purpose of this message is to provide status update regarding the Inspection of Public Records Act (hereinafter “IPRA”) request you provided the City of Las Cruces (hereinafter “City” or “Las Cruces”). Pursuant to NMSA 1978, § 14-2-10, the City has determined that your written request is excessively burdensome and/or broad. More specifically, the City has determined that it requires an additional reasonable period of time to gather, review, and appropriately redact any and all public records associated with your request. 

The City is still currently in the process of gathering, reviewing, and appropriately redacting the public records associated with your request. Although the City cannot anticipate when the responsive records associated with your request will become available, the City will produce them within a reasonable period of time. Further, the City will provide an additional written status update regarding your request within fifteen (15) days from the date of this message. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Should you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact my office. Sincerely, 
Christine Rivera 
Records Custodian 
(575) 541-2112

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all receipts, records, documents that pertain to the cleaning, seizing, storage, and disposal of Sean Derning's on Binford Road, that support Julia Barnes claim the County has spent $100,000 on seizing his possessions in the December 19 2025 addition of the Marin Independent Journal.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robbie Powelson

title: Public Records Request – Microsoft 365 Administrator Hiring Process

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request – Microsoft 365 Administrator Hiring Process
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To the Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law (M.G.L. c.66, §10), I respectfully request access to all records, documents, and communications related to the hiring process for the Microsoft 365 Administrator position within the Department of Innovation & Technology, City of Worcester, posted in 2025.

This request includes, but is not limited to:

1. **All interview materials**, including:
   - Interview scoresheets, panelist rankings, written or digital evaluations
   - Any compiled assessments, rubrics, candidate comparison summaries, or recommendation memos

2. **All internal communications** related to the hiring process, including:
   - Emails, memos, letters, Microsoft Teams or Slack messages, and calendar invites
   - Meeting recordings, scheduling threads, and attachments
   - Communications sent or received by Michael Hamel, Samantha Sendrowski, **Moby George**, HR personnel, interview panelists, or any Department of Innovation & Technology leadership
   - Specifically covering any candidates, test results, decision timelines, or escalation concerns
   - From April 1, 2025 to the present date

3. **Hiring process documentation**, such as:
   - Full timeline of job posting, interview scheduling, test administration, debriefs, and offer stages
   - Number of applicants, screening procedures, and filtering criteria
   - Any instructions or documentation provided to interviewers

4. **All assessment materials**, including:
   - Technical test prompts, evaluation rubrics, scoring forms
   - Written/recorded test feedback and related correspondence or commentary
   - Internal discussions on the test’s creation, intent, or purpose

5. **All offer documentation**, including:
   - Drafts and final offer letters (candidate names may be redacted)
   - Related internal approvals, HR communications, or final decision emails

6. **Meeting materials**, including:
   - Agendas, minutes, summaries, attendance logs, and calendar invites from hiring-related meetings

7. **Any records referencing candidate follow-up, escalation, reconsideration, or delays**, including:
   - Emails or notes discussing communication from candidates
   - Internal messages referencing escalation to the CIO or Department leadership
   - Records discussing hiring delays, decision deferrals, or process suspension

8. **Documentation of any changes to the role or reporting structure**, including:
   - Revisions to the job description, responsibilities, or departmental ownership of the Microsoft 365 Administrator role
   - Especially any such documentation involving Samantha Sendrowski or **Moby George**

Please include **all responsive documents from April 1, 2025 through the present**, including any drafts, tracked changes, metadata, or attachments. I request these records be provided **electronically** in original formats (.pdf, .msg, .docx, .eml, etc.), with metadata preserved where applicable.

If there are any fees, please notify me in advance. This request is submitted in the interest of public transparency and accountability.

Sincerely,  
[Anonymous Requester]

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel S. Moore

communications.subject: [Records Center] City Public Records Request :: W070085-050825
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of May 08, 2025, Reference # W070085-050825. 

Dear Daniel Moore, 

My name is Michael Manning and I am the City of Worcester's (City) new Records Access Officer. Part of my transition into this role has been to review outstanding requests and attempt to bring them to a resolution. It has come to my attention that your May 8, 2025 public records request to the City remains outstanding. This request sought the following: Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law (M.G.L. c.66, §10), I respectfully request access to all records, documents, and communications related to the hiring process for the Microsoft 365 Administrator position within the Department of Innovation & Technology, City of Worcester, posted in 2025.As 

This request includes, but is not limited to: 

1. **All interview materials**, including: 
- Interview scoresheets, panelist rankings, written or digital evaluations 
- Any compiled assessments, rubrics, candidate comparison summaries, or recommendation memos 

2. **All internal communications** related to the hiring process, including: 
- Emails, memos, letters, Microsoft Teams or Slack messages, and calendar invites 
- Meeting recordings, scheduling threads, and attachments 
- Communications sent or received by Michael Hamel, Samantha Sendrowski, **Moby George**, HR personnel, interview panelists, or any Department of Innovation & Technology leadership 
- Specifically covering any candidates, test results, decision timelines, or escalation concerns 
- From April 1, 2025 to the present date 

3. **Hiring process documentation**, such as: 
- Full timeline of job posting, interview scheduling, test administration, debriefs, and offer stages 
- Number of applicants, screening procedures, and filtering criteria 
- Any instructions or documentation provided to interviewers 

4. **All assessment materials**, including: 
- Technical test prompts, evaluation rubrics, scoring forms 
- Written/recorded test feedback and related correspondence or commentary 
- Internal discussions on the test’s creation, intent, or purpose 

5. **All offer documentation**, including: 
- Drafts and final offer letters (candidate names may be redacted) 
- Related internal approvals, HR communications, or final decision emails 

6. **Meeting materials**, including: 
- Agendas, minutes, summaries, attendance logs, and calendar invites from hiring-related meetings 

7. **Any records referencing candidate follow-up, escalation, reconsideration, or delays**, including: 
- Emails or notes discussing communication from candidates 
- Internal messages referencing escalation to the CIO or Department leadership 
- Records discussing hiring delays, decision deferrals, or process suspension 

8. **Documentation of any changes to the role or reporting structure**, including: 
- Revisions to the job description, responsibilities, or departmental ownership of the Microsoft 365 Administrator role 
- Especially any such documentation involving Samantha Sendrowski or **Moby George** 

Please include **all responsive documents from April 1, 2025 through the present**, including any drafts, tracked changes, metadata, or attachments. I request these records be provided **electronically** in original formats (.pdf, .msg, .docx, .eml, etc.), with metadata preserved where applicable. 
initial matter your request for "all records, documents, and communications related to the hiring process for the Microsoft 365 Administrator position within the Department of Innovation & Technology, City of Worcester, posted in 2025." fails to reasonably describe the record or category of records that you are seeking. The Suffolk Superior Court found that under the Public Records Law “[t]he reasonable description requirement contemplates that a requesting party will identify documents or categories of documents with sufficient particularity that government employees will be able to understand exactly what they are looking for, and then make a prompt production.” See Jaideep Chawla v. Dept of Revenue, Suffolk. Sup. No. l 784CV02087, at 2 (January 23, 2019). The court further indicated “[r]equests for documents that are articulated with very broad language that calls upon non-lawyer administrative personnel to interpret the scope of what is sought, and then make fine judgments about what documents are and are not sufficiently ‘related’ to the category of materials requested, will not satisfy this statutory standard.”  Accordingly, your request for a virtually unlimited scope of documents "...related to the hiring process for the Microsoft 365 Administrator position within the Department of Innovation & Technology, City of Worcester, posted in 2025" is not sufficiently particular as to satisfy the statutory standard of a request that “reasonably described the public record sought.” See G. L. c. 66, § 10(a)(i). 
I will now proceed to address the enumerated categories of your request. With regards to the items sought by categories one (all interview materials) and four (all assessment materials) these requests seek records that are exempt under Exemption (L) of the Public Records Law. These records constitute questions and answers, scoring keys and sheets and other materials used to develop, administer or score job interviews for the Microsoft 365 Administrator and similar positions within the City's government. The City frequently reuses identical or very similar questions when conducting job interviews. To release these records would risk future candidates gaining an unfair advantage when interviewing with the City.  The City will also withhold "[a]ny instructions or documentation provided to interviewers" and "screening procedures, and filtering criteria" under Exemption (L) for the reasons noted above. 
With regards to the portions of your requests that seek communications from the City and between City employees, pursuant to G. L. c. 66, § 10(b)(vii), it is valid for the City to suggest a “reasonable modification of the scope of the request or offer to assist the requestor to modify the scope of the request if doing so would enable the City to produce records sought more efficiently and affordably.” See G. L. c. 66, § 10(b)(vii). In order for the City to search for communications responsive to your request, I would suggest that you provide key words for the communications that you are searching for and specific city employees or departments who you believe may have records responsive to your request (I understand that for some of the items sought that you provided names of City employees) but it would be helpful to expand this for all communications sought.  In addition to the aforementioned suggestions, it may also be useful to narrow the date range of your request. 
With regards to your request for "[a]ll offer documentation" (category 5), the City will withhold all offer letters under Exemption (c), offer letters are found within City employees personnel files and are therefore exempt from disclosure. See Colman M. Herman v. City of Boston, et. al., Suffolk Superior Court, Civil Action No. 2384CV2395 (June 20, 2024) (“personnel files . . . shall be considered exempt under exemption (c)") 
Finally in light of the time elapsed since you placed your public records request, should you wish to withdraw this request, please let me know and the City can consider this request closed. 
Under the Public Records Law, I must inform you that you have the right to appeal this response to the Supervisor of Records pursuant to subsection (a) of section 10A of the Public Records Law and 950 CMR 32.08(1). You also have the right to seek judicial review of an unfavorable decision by commencing a civil action in the superior court under subsection (c) of section 10A. 
Sincerely, 
Michael Manning 
Records Access Officer 
City of Worcester Law Department

title: Recruitment and Hiring (Dallas Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Recruitment and Hiring (Dallas Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the department's efforts to recruit and hire new officers:
Records include digital and physical, released in their native forms (Excel, PDF, etc)

- ad purchases
- contracts with vendors for ad placement, recruitment and hiring 
- market research and data, if collected
- brand and department strategies created by ad agencies or internally
- data related to applications, KPIs of recruitment and hiring campaigns
- PowerPoint or equivalent presentations, including accompanying documents related to recruitment, hiring, and marketing strategies
- Budgets for recruitment and hiring internally, and the total money spent 
- Pay bonuses or financial incentives to retain officers
- Data by year on the number of officers, sworn and non-sworn

Search from 2021 to today's date.
Please provide in rolling production

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

title: Library Contract Request: Lexis Nexis (Nexis Uni) (Arizona State University)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Library Contract Request: Lexis Nexis (Nexis Uni) (Arizona State University)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with Lexis Nexis relating to the licensing of library database Nexis Uni; and

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations with language governing the use of library database Nexis Uni. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of library database Nexis Uni.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

mo

communications.subject: Your Arizona State University public records request #25-211 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Arizona State University ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-211 has been submitted successfully. Thank you for submitting a public records request to Arizona State University. We will begin reviewing your request now. If we need additional information to process it, or if we are unable to do so, we will be in touch with you shortly.  Otherwise, we will begin gathering any responsive records from the relevant departments and/or individuals at ASU. After the records have been gathered and individually reviewed to determine if they are responsive and whether any confidential information needs to be withheld or redacted, they will be provided to you. The amount of time necessary to complete this process varies depending on a variety of factors, including how extensive the request is, how responsive information is stored, and what kinds of review and redaction are necessary.  Please be aware that ASU receives a large number of records requests and we may be occupied in processing requests received prior to yours. You are welcome to check on the status of your request at any time through the online portal you used to submit your request (https://asu.nextrequest.com/). When the responsive documents are ready for you, you may also use this portal to access them and to pay any charges associated with your request. If you have additional questions regarding this process or the status of your request, you may submit them through the portal or by email to publicrecords@asu.edu.  ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Arizona State University.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

title: CA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Imperial County Ca Registrar Of Voters)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Imperial County Ca Registrar Of Voters)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast generated by the relevant voting system technology in your County in that year. In case it is helpful to see an example of the type of data I am requesting from your county, Alameda County has these records posted for the 2024 General Election on their Election Information for November 2024 under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report”.

Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: Public Records Request for Data on Arrests in DCF Congregate Care Facilities

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on Arrests in DCF Congregate Care Facilities
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

December 1, 2025

John J. Wilson, Jr., Esq.
City Clerk/Records Access Officer (RAO) Methuen Police Department
41 Pleasant Street, Methuen, MA 01844

Dear Mr. Wilson,

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Law, M.G.L. c. 66, § 10, for public records in the custody of the Methuen Police Department.

I am writing as a JD Research Fellow in the Cradle to Prison Pipeline Project at Northeastern University. Our project conducts original research to fill data gaps along the cradle to prison pipeline and produces publicly available research and data analysis on important social issues affecting youth in the justice system.

I request the following public records, as defined in M.G.L. c. 4, § 7 (26):

**The total number of arrests made at the following DCF-contracted congregate care facilities located within Methuen during the period of January 1, 2020 through the present date:**

1. Pinedale (American Training Inc., located at 6 Campanelli Drive, Andover, MA 01810, serving Methuen) - Community Treatment Residence
2. 17 Roseland (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Community Treatment Residence
3. 285 Broadway (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Community Treatment Residence
4. 7 Edwards Ave (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Community Treatment Residence
5. 98 Haverhill (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Community Treatment Residence
6. St. Ann's Campus (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Community Treatment Residence
7. St. Ann's Campus (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Emergency Residence
8. 17 Roseland (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Residential School
9. 285 Broadway (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Residential School
10. 7 Edwards Ave (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Residential School
11. 98 Haverhill (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Residential School
12. St. Ann's Campus (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Residential School
13. 285 Broadway (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Youth and Young Adult Group Residence 14. 7 Edwards Ave (St. Ann's Home, Inc.) - Youth and Young Adult Group Residence 15. Lowell Street (The Key Program, Inc.) - Emergency Residence
16. New Directions (The Key Program, Inc.) - Intensive Treatment Residence
17. Any other DCF-contracted congregate care facilities operating within Methuen jurisdiction during this time period

Please provide the total number of arrests for each facility listed above, broken down by calendar year (2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024).

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to examine patterns of law enforcement involvement at congregate care facilities serving youth in state custody. The public has an interest in understanding how youth in the care and custody of the Commonwealth are being treated within these facilities.

Please provide public records in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M.G.L. c. 66, § 6A(d).

The Public Records Law requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to this request are not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply.

If you have any questions about this request or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,
Erin Stewart
JD Research Fellow, Cradle to Prison Pipeline Project Northeastern University
(617) 373-5149
er.stewart@northeastern.edu

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Makayla Connor

communications.subject: PRR-2025-520
communications.communication:
Dear Makayla Connor,

I am reaching out in regard to the above-mentioned Public Records Request you submitted to the Methuen Police Department. This office is actively working to fulfill your request, but in order to do so I need clarification on some of the addresses you provided. A few of the locations listed appear to be duplicate entries (8,9,10,11,13 & 14) however, residences 6,7, 12,15 & 16 do not have the addresses listed. Can you please provide the specific residential addresses for these care facilities? I have attached a copy of your request for reference.

If you have any questions regarding this matter, please contact me directly. Thank you.

Respectfully,

Brittany Getchell
Methuen Records Department
90 Hampshire Street
Methuen, MA 01844
(978)983-8747

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request #PRR-2025-520
communications.communication:
Hello-

We had contacted DCF to receive the specific addresses for these congregate care facilities. However, we were unable to obtain them due to confidentiality concerns. 

Best,

Makayla Connor

communications.subject: RE: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request #PRR-2025-520
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

Thank you for the clarification. Unfortunately, this office does not have a breakdown or listing of each DCF care facility that operates within the City of Methuen, so I will only be able to research the locations you previously provided.

Please be advised that the Methuen Police Department has utilized 3 separate reporting platforms since January 2020 to present and we do not have a way to search arrests at specific locations. Therefore, I will need to manually search each arrest/location over the five-year period you requested. This will take a significant amount of time to process and compile the data.

If you have any questions regarding this matter, please let me know. Thank you and have a great holiday!

Respectfully,

Brittany Getchell
Methuen Records Department
90 Hampshire Street
Methuen, MA 01844
(978)983-8747

title: Robert Robideau (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Robert Robideau (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents and files, including letters, memos, emails and all communications pertaining to former American Indian Movement activist Robert "Bob" Robideau (born November 11, 1946 – died February 17, 2009). An obituary of whom was published in the Oregonian on February 9, 2009. A copy of his obituary is attached to this request as a PDF, and it may also be found at https://www.oregonlive.com/portland/2009/02/robert_robideau_native_america.html

I would also like to request a search of all available cross-index files for mentions of Robert Robideau in other documents, to be included with this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Estes

title: GA - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: GA - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am a researcher interested in fishing and hunting license prices. I would like to obtain annual data on the yearly recreational fishing and hunting license and tag price data from 1990 to present. Specifically, I would like records showing the fees for the following licenses and tags for both residents and nonresidents (where applicable) from 1/1/1990 to 1/12/26 (listed annually, i.e., one fee per license/tag per year from 1990 to 2026). Please also include the agent fee, where applicable. Please provide fees pertaining to adults. In cases of reciprocal pricing agreements with other states, please provide both the special reciprocal prices to residents of those states and the general price to residents of all states without a reciprocal pricing agreement, where necessary.

Hunting - Annual, One-Day
Big Game - Annual, One-Day
Alligator Harvest Permit
Fishing - Annual, One-Day
Trout - Annual, One-Day
Sportman's

If data is not available back to 1990 for one or more of the specified license or tag prices, please provide data from the oldest year on record to present. To what extent license or tag names might have changed, please match to the most similar license or tag, if possible, for continuation purposes. If possible, please provide the data in a table. Thank you for your help.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christian Hachtman

ORIGINAL REQUEST:

communications.subject: GORA Response for Christian Hachtman
communications.communication:
Dear Christian Hachtman:

Based on the information you provided and pursuant to Georgia Open Records Act received January 14, 2026, an excel file has been created and attached. The data contained in this file is compiled to the best of my ability from historical Georgia Hunting and Fishing regulation magazines.

Dates of Note:
    1993: Price changes took effect April 1, 1993, Non-Resident Florida License no longer offered Archery appears to be written as Primitive Weapon
    1996: Archery / Firearms (all weapons) license offered
    1999: Lifetime Licenses became available and Online License Sales becomes available
    2003: April Alligator License introduced and All weapons license is removed
    2004: March Recreational Licenses went 365
    2005: Discount Senior and Non-Resident Grandchild Lifetime Licenses started
    2008: Veteran Lifetime License started
    2009: License Price Changes; Mainly Non-Resident. 7-day Licenses stopped. 2 years started
    2014: Lifetime Shooting Preserve License offered
    2017: Price Changes took effect starting July.
    2018: July 1st Lifetime Prices increased and additional licenses offered
    2024: Federal Duck stamp increased in price



Jeffrey Ozburn

Database Administrator 2, License and Boat Registration Unit

Wildlife Resources Division<http://georgiawildlife.com/>
Office: (706) 557-3250



Facebook<http://www.facebook.com/WildlifeResourcesDivisionGADNR> • Twitter<http://twitter.com/georgiawild> • Instagram<http://www.instagram.com/georgiawildlife>
Buy a hunting or fishing license today!<http://georgiawildlife.com/licenses-permits-passes>

A division of the
GEORGIA DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES

title: Huston Plan (National Security Agency)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Huston Plan (National Security Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the "Huston Plan" produced by the Interagency Committee on Intelligence (Ad Hoc) and all documents mentioning or relating to it. For reference and help locating relevant materials, please consult CIA-RDP87B01034R000700230008-6, available on CIA's website.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities for AND Magazine, MuckRock and Glomar Disclosure and have an open arrangement with each. My articles have been widely read, with some reaching over 100,000 readers. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Emma Best

title: Dataset: 911 Call Data (Emergency Communications Division, Greensboro, Nc, Usa)

communications.subject: RE: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Dataset: 911 Call Data (Emergency Communications Division, Greensboro, Nc, Usa)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

RAW Computer Aided Dispatch Data queried out of your emergency phone system on 911 calls for service from January 2014 to the most recent date data is collected. In CSV, TXT, or XML format, a machine-readable spreadsheet (not XLSX format). 

Here are the column headers which I am requesting:

Master Incident Number or Event Number – Unique numerical identifier of the call for service
Case Number – If an incident report was written, this is the file number, which can be joined to the incidents and arrests datasets
Call Date – Date the call for service was generated
Call Time – Time the call for service was generated
Source – How the call was generated from the public, or self-initiated by an officer
Priority – The priority level of the call response, with ‘P’ being the highest, followed in order numerically
Nature – The description of the call for service.
Address – The block number and street or intersection of the call for service.
Latitude/longitude - coordinates for call of service
X – Mapping coordinate of the call for service
Y – Mapping coordinate of the call for service
District – The patrol district where the call for service was located.
Beat – The patrol beat where the call for service was located, which is a sub-division of the district
Tract – The census tract where the incident occurred, based on 2010 census data
Disposition – How the call for service was closed
Cancelled – Whether the call for service was cancelled prior to officer arrival
Dispatch Date and Time - The exact date and time when the dispatcher sent the call to emergency responders, such as police, fire, or EMS
Entry Date and Time - The date and time when the call was initially logged into the 911 computer-aided dispatch (CAD) system
Received Date and Time - The date and time when the 911 call was first answered by the dispatch center
Enroute Date and Time - The date and time when the assigned responder (e.g., a patrol car, ambulance, or fire truck) began traveling to the incident location
On Scene Date and Time - The date and time when the responder arrived at the scene of the incident
Close Date and Time - The date and time when the incident or call was marked as completed or resolved in the CAD system
Dispatcher ID - A unique identifier for the dispatcher who handled and managed the 911 call. This may be used for tracking or auditing purposes

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Filed Requests

communications.subject: RE: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Dataset: 911 Call Data (Emergency Communications Division, Greensboro, Nc, Usa)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Upon review, additional data fields are necessary to fully interpret the records already requested and/or produced. I therefore request the following additional column headers, to the extent they exist in your CAD system, for the same date range (January 2014 to the most recent date data is collected), in CSV, TXT, or XML format:

* Unique Identifier – A unique numerical identifier for each call for service, if distinct from the master incident or event number
* Dispatcher ID(s) – Identifier(s) for all dispatchers who handled the call, if multiple
* Responder ID – A unique identifier for the responding unit(s) or team(s)
* Prime Unit – Identifier indicating the primary response unit
* Other Units – All additional responding unit identifiers
* Back-up Requested – Indicator or code showing whether back-up was requested
* Transport – Indicator (Y/N) of whether transport occurred
* Transport Start and End Times – If transport occurred
* Transport Destination Address – The address or facility to which transport occurred
* Program or Response Type – Any field identifying non-police, co-response, or alternative response teams (including behavioral health, crisis, or care-based units), if applicable

If any of the above fields are stored under different names, codes, or tables, I request the functional equivalent fields.

I also request any available data dictionary or codebook necessary to interpret these fields.

If you deny any portion of this supplemental request, please cite the specific statutory exemption relied upon and provide the applicable appeal procedures as required by law.

As before, these records are requested for non-commercial purposes and will be made available to the general public. Please inform me in advance of any fees associated with fulfilling this request.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Sincerely,
FR

communications.communication:
Dear Requester,

In response to your public records request concerning 911 Call Data (Emergency Communications Division, Greensboro, Nc, Usa), Guilford Metro 911 responds, "We have a report that includes all relevant information, except for the sections highlighted in blue on the attached PDF, which contain GPD data exclusively from 2005 to 2025.  Note - The report we have does not include EMS or Fire Events."  Please be aware that this is the report that exists.  We do not have a report that contains all of the information requested.  Pursuant to NCGS 132-6.2(e), the City is not required to respond to a request for a copy of a public record by creating or compiling a record that does not exist.  Requesters should be aware that the PIRT Policy and North Carolina's Public Records Law do not require the City to do research, analyze data, or answer written questions.

Please download the spreadsheets from OneDrive by clicking the following link:

https://greensboroncgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/18965_greensboro-nc_gov/IgAuzfmRsgCGTYERGxImPx12AXzjEJi7Awsf_E8H3FGTmos?email=202381-06639010%40requests.muckrock.com&e=bwi3oi

Information provided in a records request is subject to North Carolina's Public Records law and can be disclosed to any person.  Information in your request is disclosed on our public records request portal when your request is complete.  This includes your name, e-mail address, your request, and any responsive records.

Thank you for your public records request,

Kurt Brenneman, Public Records Request Administrator
[cid:image005.png@01DC8BBB.1DFD5880]
Greensboro Central Library
219 N. Church Street
PO Box 3178, Greensboro, NC  27402-3178
Phone:  336-373-3636
www.greensborolibrary.org<http://www.greensborolibrary.org/>

[Vision Statement for Email Signature FINAL GSO]

title: Verra Violations (Bellevue Police Department)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Verra Violations (Bellevue Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Since January 1, 2025, please provide records, by month, for the number of violations forwarded by Verra for law enforcement review, and the number of violations disapproved by law enforcement, and the total monthly law enforcement approval rate of violations transmitted by Verra for law enforcement review

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jon Smith
