communications.communication:
Dear Jon Smith, 
 
Thank you for submitting your request for public records to the City of Bellevue Police Department. Your request was received in our office on 12/22/2025 7:24:08 PM and given the reference number P007576-122225 for tracking purposes. The details of your request are below.  
 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Since January 1, 2025, please provide records, by month, for the number of violations forwarded by Verra for law enforcement review, and the number of violations disapproved by law enforcement, and the total monthly law enforcement approval rate of violations transmitted by Verra for law enforcement review 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Jon Smith 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2161251/ 
The City must provide a preliminary response to your request within five (5) business days (RCW 42.56.520); the day the request is received does not count as one of the five (5) days. Weekends and holidays observed by the City are also excluded in the calculation. For additional information regarding our response options, please click here: Prompt Response Required. The City of Bellevue has adopted a  Public Records Fee Schedule, please review it for information associated with fees that may be assessed pursuant to your request. 
You may monitor the progress of your request via the link below; you will receive an email when your request has been completed. We thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
City of Bellevue Police Department

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P007576-122225
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line. Anything below will not be viewable to staff. --- 
01/22/2026 P007576-122225 Jon Smith, 
Records responsive to your request are now available via the City of Bellevue Public Records Portal website. Pop-ups may need to be enabled on your internet browser to access your files for download. This concludes our search of records in the custody of the Bellevue Police Department. Please be advised, we are not permitted to upload records to external websites. If there is a different method of your receipt you would prefer, such as direct email, pickup, mailing, or in-person inspection, please let us know. This is our final, definitive response and your request is closed.  As the city does not intend to further address the request, the Public Records Act one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has now started to run. Pursuant to the Public Records Act RCW 42.56, responsive records may be redacted or exempt. Please review the accompanying privilege log for further information, if such redactions or exemptions have been applied. Per the State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56.120) and City Public Records Act Rules (Section 6), a public records request may be considered abandoned and subsequently closed if a requestor fails to fulfill their obligation to claim an installment of records; claim the entire production of records; inspect the records; or fails to pay the deposit or final payment for requested records within 30 days of this notification. If you believe the information furnished has been incorrectly redacted or is incomplete, you may file a written appeal. The appeal must include your name and address, a copy of the redacted document and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. Please mail your appeal to: Bellevue Police Department 
Attn: Records Supervisor 
P.O. Box 90012 
Bellevue, WA  98009-9012 If you require any further assistance from the Bellevue Police Department regarding this matter or have questions, please contact the Records Unit via the Public Records Portal or by telephone at (425) 452-6917 within 30 days of this notification. Thank you, Jessica Abbott 
Bellevue Police Department 
RPC 4.4 Inadvertent Disclosure Notification: CR 26 (b) (6) Claw Back Provision *** Please read this notice carefully *** Dear legal practitioner: Please take notice that we take reasonable precautions to prevent the disclosure of privileged or confidential materials, including those protected by the attorney-client privilege and/or work product doctrine, when responding to request for records.  These precautions include, but are not limited to, carefully locating and assembling responsive records, performing an intra-departmental review of the records for purposes of determining whether they contain any privileged or confidential materials, forwarding the records to the County Prosecuting Attorney's Office for independent legal review, meeting and conferring with the Prosecuting Attorney's Office to compare and reconcile any conflicting results of our separate independent reviews and, if necessary, creating a withholding log.  Despite our having taken these precautions, occasionally a mistake is made and privileged or confidential documents are inadvertently produced.  To that end, we wanted to notify you that there is a possibility that the records being produced may contain privileged or confidential materials.  The inadvertent or unintentional production of privileged or confidential documents, without a privileged or confidentiality designation should not be considered a waiver in whole or in part of any claim of privileged or confidential treatment, and any document that initially is produced without bearing a privileged or confidentiality designation may later be so designated.  In the event that you believe you have received privileged or confidential materials, we would ask that you promptly notify us of this fact and take action as necessary to comply with the obligations set forth in Rule of Professional Conduct 4.4 and/or Civil Rule 26 (b)(6).

communications.subject: FW: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Verra AE Contracts (Tigard Police Department)
communications.communication:
Research into this request has been completed.  The requested contract can be obtained from the Tigard Police Department after a fee of $45.97 is received by this agency. This fee may be paid in person by cash, check or credit card or by mail in a check or money order with your written request to Tigard Police Department, 13125 SW Hall Blvd., Tigard, OR 97223: attn. Ambra Farrier.  Please make sure to include a return address of where you would like the document sent in your request if you would like it mailed or an email address if you would like it emailed.

The fee is based on $10 for first 10 pages, $0.30 per page thereafter and an hourly rate of $77.89. Public records requests that involve more than one half hour of staff time for identification, location, retrieval, review, and duplicating will include a charge for staff time. The request will not be started until the fee is received. The following is breakdown of the fee:

70-page document - $10 for first 15 pages + 55 pages x 0.30 = $26.50
0.75 hours of staff time at $77.89 per hour (1st half hour free) x 0.25 hours = $19.47

Certain portions of proprietary and trade secret information in the contract will be redacted based on exemption from public disclosure per ORS 192.345(2).

Thank you,

[cid:image003.png@01DC8094.91C3DDC0]
Ambra Farrier | Records Supervisor
City of Tigard | Police Department
Direct: 503.718.2573<tel:5037182573> | Business: 503.639.6168<tel:5035198960>
13125 SW Hall Boulevard, Tigard OR 97223 | tigard-or.gov<https://www.tigard-or.gov/>

RE:  Public Records Request#: C434642-121825 
 
Dear Martin Brooks, 
 
 PAYMENT DUE 
 
The City may be the custodian of at least some of the requested public records and a payment is due to continue processing this request. Please log into the Portland Public Records Request Center to pay these fees. 
 
Fees include research time to locate and analyze the requested records, even if no records are located or if the requested records are determined to be exempt from disclosure. We will not be working on your request until we receive the payment. 
 
Please log in to the Portland Public Records Request Center (copy and right click this link to open it in your browser) and make a payment on this request. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXaJMtqP7g2cV29cew33RS39hJehB57THn35e-2FFN1nR2OpezWpi-2ByI6lQhSlVQmegUSk5naeFF0oAJvNULndOxlrfKCIR3EkQf0SHeW7TIJBxCxVB_CVabcpH0xu5iKH7emUqIxx-2FGrf4QG6GZw1m8YKsBzYvSN8jq0ZIDrIyJ4bJj8CWmAgnDR-2FoEoHJbNxWidVzTa6QkgRciyYQOZLKXSQ2myPEovFJmYgg9d1WoM7X4HTv6w3WlBnnQL2diOQSmrbaceFOetSnhOe5G-2B-2F-2FUhWbA7saKLhlQpGKTEdALqqqtKfvGscXp-2Bu2JS470eNBo9prz8VN1blRD88AFgSYYNweh2K0sdAfUQjRbwZlCl3y-2B3iuc3b1Q2I7VAz70iBt6F-2BKGnHp9uAxoI46tnB7z7Lfgq6o7rrG0VsD0lrx-2FhTFM1awjLQ04AV2PdAKsGdT5190OayXlEAgz3luLYtzvumvo0DBeDtxx65H3nGfuZ6EI78dl) 
 
You may pay by electronic check or credit card by going to "My Records Request Center" and select "View My Invoices." Then scroll to find your open invoice and select "Make Payment." Follow the screen prompts to make a payment. 
 
Mailing a check could delay the response time and it is preferable that you use the online payment portal to make an electronic payment. However, if you need to mail a check, please reply to this message and ask for the correct address. Please be sure and provide your Reference Number (C434642-121825) on your check. 
 
Invoice Number: INV25-C434642-1 
Invoice Date: 12/18/2025 
Estimated Amount: $2.00 
 The above amount is the estimated fee for filling your public records request. Payment of the amount due is required to begin work. In most cases, for amounts over $25.00 you only need to pay a 50% deposit. If this is the case, a separate email listing the specifics and conditions for filling the request will be sent to you. By paying the invoice, you are confirming this fee estimate and agreeing to pay the cost of fulfilling this public records request according to the conditions set forth by the City. Please be advised that pursuant to ORS 192.329(3)(b) and (4)(b), your public records request will be closed if payment is not received within sixty (60) days of this invoice. 
 
Sincerely, 
 
 
City of Portland Public Records Responder

Dear Martin ,

After seeing what is in the report, if you want to request any of the videos please make an audio-visual request.  If you do, then send a message on this request and include the new request reference number.  I will process that request.  ** 
The City of Portland received a Public Records Request from you on December 18, 2025 for the following: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records: 

I hope you are doing well. 
I am requesting the following records related to this case: 
• Body-worn camera (BWC) footage

• Incident reports 
• Investigation footage 
Case details:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days. 

Sincerely, 

Martin Brooks

The City now considers your request fulfilled and it will be closed. 
Sincerely, 
Jeff Cammack

title: Lake Washington School District – INVOICES - Public Records Fees Assessed (2020-2025)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District – INVOICES - Public Records Fees Assessed (2020-2025)
communications.communication:
October 02, 2025

To: PublicRecordsRequest@lwsd.org

Lake Washington School District – INVOICES - Public Records Fees Assessed (2020-2025)


PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST – RCW 42.56


To whom it may concern,

Pursuant to the Washington State Public Records Act (RCW 42.56), I hereby request the following identifiable public records:

1. Public Records Request Fee Invoices (2020–Present)

Please provide complete electronic copies of all invoices issued by Lake Washington School District (“the District”) for public records requests, covering the date range of January 1, 2020 through [today’s date in 2025].

This request includes but is not limited to:

- All invoices, billing statements, or itemized charges for fees assessed for fulfilling Public Records Act requests.
- Any fee estimates or final invoices issued to requestors.
- Supporting calculations, line items, or spreadsheets attached to fee invoices.
- Records reflecting the method of fee assessment under RCW 42.56.120 or related statutes.
- Records showing the number of files, pages, or gigabytes associated with each invoice or fee assessment.

2. Scope of Records

This request applies to all responsive records created, stored, transmitted, or retained by the District for the years 2020 through 2025, including:

- Electronic invoices in PDF, DOCX, XLSX, MSG, or other native formats.
- Itemized billing spreadsheets or fee calculation documents.
- Records stored on District servers, computers, or cloud services used for invoice generation or distribution.

3. Format of Production & Delivery

- Provide all records in their native electronic format (e.g., PDF, XLSX, DOCX).
- If necessary, bundle responsive records into the fewest files possible using free .zip compression.
- Production should be in reverse chronological order (most recent first).
- Delivery Method:
  - Direct email attachment, or
  - Direct internet download link with no password and no registration required.
- Expressly prohibited: Do not require use of JustFOIA, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAOnline, or any similar third-party portal.

4. Exemption Logs

If any redactions or withholdings are made, the District must provide a detailed exemption log, identifying:
- The statutory RCW exemption invoked.
- The record type and specific withheld portion.
- The number of invoices, pages, or documents withheld in whole or redacted.

5. Fees

If fees apply to the production of this request, please provide an itemized fee estimate in advance. Artificial inflation of costs by fragmenting or unbundling records that could reasonably be produced together is not permissible under RCW 42.56.120.

6. Preservation of Records

This request anticipates litigation. Under RCW 42.56.100 and WAC 44-14-03005, the District must preserve all potentially responsive invoices and related records until this request is fully resolved. Destruction of responsive records after receipt of this request may constitute a violation of RCW 40.16.010 and RCW 40.16.020.

7. Exemption Challenge 

- Public Record Status: All fee invoices and billing records are “writings” under RCW 42.56.010(4), as they are prepared, used, or retained by the District in connection with the performance of a governmental function.
- No Blanket Exemption: There is no statutory exemption for public records fee invoices. Exemptions must be specific, narrowly applied, and accompanied by a detailed exemption log (Sanders v. State, 169 Wn.2d 827 (2010)).
- Judicial Review: If LWSD denies access, I will seek judicial review under RCW 42.56.550, including recovery of attorney fees and statutory penalties per day per record unlawfully withheld (Yousoufian v. Office of Ron Sims, 168 Wn.2d 444 (2010)).

8. Commercial Purpose Declaration

This request is not made for any commercial purpose and does not seek a “list of individuals” as prohibited by RCW 42.56.070(8).


Please provide responsive records within five business days as required by RCW 42.56.

Good Luck.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District – INVOICES - Public Records Fees Assessed (2020-2025)
communications.communication:
Dear Requester,
This email concerns the public records request, Request Number: PRR-2025-241<https://lwsdwa.justfoia.com/PublicPortal/Index?RequestNumber=PRR-2025-241&SecurityKey=6D0290CB> , you submitted that was received by Lake Washington School District on Thursday, October 2, 2025. A fee has been issued for your request for records.
Following the submission of your request, a preliminary search was completed. The estimated volume of records and associated costs are detailed in the invoice provided. District policy requires that you be provided with a summary of applicable anticipated charges before charges are imposed. This is to allow the requestor to revise the request in an effort to reduce the applicable charges. To this end, a detailed invoice is provided separately for your review. Please click here to view: Request Number: PRR-2025-241<https://lwsdwa.justfoia.com/PublicPortal/Index?RequestNumber=PRR-2025-241&SecurityKey=6D0290CB>
Please be advised that District policy/procedure [https://go.boarddocs.com/wa/lwsd/Board.nsf/goto?open&id=CFPURL7D5430 ] contains the following schedule of charges that may apply to your request:
1. Ten cents per page for public records scanned into an electronic format or for the use of District equipment to scan the records;
2. Five cents per each four electronic files or attachments uploaded to email, cloud-based data storage service, or other means of electronic delivery;
3. Ten cents per gigabyte for the transmission of public records in an electronic format or for the use of District equipment to send the records electronically; and
4. The actual cost of any digital storage media or device provided by the District, the actual cost of any container or envelope used to mail the copies to the requestor, and the actual postage or delivery charge.
Alternatively, if the District determines and documents that the fees allowed under this procedure are clearly equal to, or less, than two dollars, the District may instead charge a flat fee of two dollars to provide the records. If the District charges a flat fee for the first installment, the District will not charge an additional flat fee or a per page fee for any subsequent installments.
Due to the volume of records, the District is exercising its discretion under District procedure and RCW 42.56.120(4) to require a deposit of ten percent of the estimated charges associated with this request.
After payment is received, we will be authorized by District procedure and the Public Records Act to begin reviewing the responsive records. At that point, we will provide you with the anticipated date of an initial installment.
Please be advised that we are required to allow you a 30-day time frame to make the pre-payment as outlined above, measured from the date of this email. A failure to receive such payment from a requester within that time frame permits us to consider their request abandoned and close it. Also, the District would also be amenable to narrowing the scope of your request in an effort to reduce the associated fees the District intends to assess.
Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns about the foregoing or any aspect of the District's work to fulfill your request.
To view your request status, please click Request Number: PRR-2025-241<https://lwsdwa.justfoia.com/PublicPortal/Index?RequestNumber=PRR-2025-241&SecurityKey=6D0290CB>


Thank you,
Public Records Office
15212 NE 95th Street
Redmond, WA 98052
publicrecordsrequest@lwsd.org

communications.subject: Lake Washington School District, WA. - Records Request PRR-2025-241 Completed
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor, 
  
 Thank you for submitting a public records request. Request Number: PRR-2025-241 has been completed. Please click on the request link to download the response documentation. 
  
 Your request, PRR-2025-241, is considered complete as we provided all records we were able to provide. 
  
 All invoices for Public Records Act request fees from 2020–2025 have been provided in their native PDF format. These invoices include the itemized charges, fee calculations, number of files, and the method of fee assessment, which satisfy the scope of your request. 
  
 The District does not maintain separate fee estimates, calculation spreadsheets, or attachments beyond what is already included in the invoices. Fee calculations are generated within the District’s database system, and no additional calculation files exist. Notification emails sent to requesters do not contain fee information or invoices and are therefore not responsive. 
  
 Some invoices include a mailing or email address in the address field, and some do not. The address field only populates when the requester entered an address or email address in the address field at the time the invoice was created. If no address was provided, the field appears blank; however, the invoice was still delivered to the requester by email. This variation reflects the information supplied by the requester and does not indicate any missing records. 
  
 Some public records requests received during the date range had not yet been invoiced at the time of your request. Because no invoice existed for those requests, there were no responsive records to produce for them. 
  
 For general information about how the District calculates Public Records Act fees, the District’s fee schedule is publicly available on our website. This information is not a responsive record but is provided for convenience. https://url4102.request.justfoia.com/ls/click?upn=u001.nrfdmL-2B1UhWpB4V2ArB2saf7hzZRTWl6NaNk2Ngw2xI94WCmlOAuubZY2eGJvWNCDbiKW-2FoHs-2Fp1FxW-2Fre9NBQ-3D-3DyqTn_h0SuGnas8NGTsUMgZjfTUup1-2F11dC-2BzV3BFgEPTU-2F76cICkW0aA3b9OCc0qi98zMMu1dVi-2Bwm4WOqv5hBFV4MaqlNGMCvCzelSW9YaEqjz0jqkoOuO4deQA-2BIrjs3i0fd40o9f-2BSwzfLrEGZTbO1K6M2frJvwyMvwFWpPaCDXnPbM2NE0-2FrbIHYK095mK0ZS-2FB7X0ZFd-2FUFLNyTn3BZDBZc8rf2F4aWRqzPl0i4NEN313f9e7121adEpmaLyndMGuNMSpAti6lxigeIpFhr-2FqTzocLuPAoDLKaAC2o3AZX7wf-2FUA2SNK8mRl0ifttZzd 
  
 With this production, the District has provided all records in its possession that are responsive to your request. 
  
  Lake Washington School District does not intend to further address the request. Please follow up with any questions within 30 days, which is 2/22/2026. The completed date, 1/22/2026, begins the one-year statute of limitations which allows you to seek judicial review on or before 1/22/2027.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request access to records relating to the four fixed traffic or surveillance cameras currently operating within the City of Novato, California, including but not limited to any automated license plate recognition (ALPR), traffic monitoring, or public-safety camera systems.

Specifically, I request the following records for the period January 1, 2022 to present, unless otherwise noted:
	1.	Camera Inventory
	•	A list of all fixed cameras operated by or accessible to the Novato Police Department within city limits, including:
	•	General location or intersection (street-level description is sufficient)
	•	Purpose (e.g., traffic monitoring, ALPR, crime prevention)
	•	Whether the camera is owned by NPD or operated by a third party
	2.	Vendors and Contracts
	•	All contracts, memoranda of understanding (MOUs), purchase orders, or agreements related to these cameras, including vendors such as (but not limited to) ALPR or traffic-camera providers
	•	Any amendments or renewals to those agreements
	3.	Policies and Procedures
	•	Policies governing:
	•	Data collection
	•	Data retention
	•	Access controls
	•	Data sharing with other agencies
	•	Public disclosure
	•	Any ALPR usage or surveillance technology policies required under California law
	4.	Data Sharing
	•	Records identifying any external agencies, jurisdictions, or third parties with whom camera data has been shared
	•	Applicable MOUs or data-sharing agreements
	5.	Privacy Impact / Oversight
	•	Any privacy impact assessments, surveillance use reports, or city council approvals related to these camera systems
	6.	Public Notice
	•	Records showing how the public is notified of the presence or use of these cameras, including signage standards or public communications

If any responsive records are held by another department or agency, please advise so I may redirect the request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Rosa

title: Request for information regarding "Flock Safety" camera installations (City and County of Denver)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for information regarding "Flock Safety" camera installations (City and County of Denver)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- A list of all current deployment locations of Flock Safety automatic license‑plate reader cameras owned, leased or operated by the City and County of Denver or the Denver Police Department (including intersections or other location identifiers).
- The number of cameras in operation as of [date] and the date of each installation.
- Any contracts, memoranda or agreements the City/Department holds with Flock Safety (or any other vendor) for camera deployment, maintenance, and data access/sharing.
- A number advising of how many license plates have been captured/detected over the last 30 days(ideally a graph).
- A list of all searches over the last 30 days using the Flock Safety system; including reason for search, search contents, officer who conducted the search, and time/date stamps.

- I've also been made aware that the Flock Safety contract with Denver has recently been renewed, and I would also like information in regards to the details of said most recent contract.
- - Any email contents/information possible in regards to the making and agreement of the most recent contract sign, or installations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sidney Engel

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request for information regarding "Flock Safety" camera installations (City and County of Denver)
communications.communication:
Hello,


The City and County of Denver operates a decentralized Colorado Open Records (CORA) program, in which each agency maintains and provides access to its own records.
Our office can provide the executed contracts related to your request, which are attached for your review. For any additional information regarding the FLOCK program, please contact the Department of Safety directly at:
https://www.denvergov.org/Government/Departments/Department-of-Public-Safety/Contact

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Park deed restrictions
communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on June 23, 2025. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, June 24, 2025.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before July 16, 2025.

Your request is being handled by Devin Farrelly. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Devin Farrelly at farrellyd@detroitmi.gov<mailto:farrellyd@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.

title: MADOC Roster 2025-11

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: MADOC Roster 2025-11
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request any spreadsheets or data sufficient to show all individuals who have worked as Corrections officers or supervisors for MADOC of any rank, including as much of the following information as can be provided in an electronic format:

Name
Year of birth
Race
Gender
Date of hire
Rank/job title
All location/facility assignments and dates of assignments
Date of separation, if applicable
Reason for separation, if applicable
Any badge numbers, employee IDs, or other unique ID numbers

Please provide current AND former employment roster data for MADOC dating back as far as electronic data in a spreadsheet format are maintained.

This request seeks electronic data. The Massachusetts Public Records Law does not distinguish between paper and electronic records, and “clearly applies to government records generated, received, or maintained electronically.” SPR Bulletin No. 4-96 (June 7, 1996). A records custodian must “furnish copies of non-exempt portions of computerized information at the cost of reproduction, unless otherwise provided by law.”  Guide to Mass. Pub. Records Law at 41 (Sec’y of State, rev. Mar. 2020, https://www.sec.state.ma.us/pre/prepdf/guide.pdf. Custodians should provide public records in electronic format unless it is not available in electronic form or the requester cannot receive or access it electronically. Id. If possible, the record should be produced in the requester’s preferred format. Id.

Invisible Institute is an award-winning nonprofit public accountability journalism organization based in Chicago. Our mission is to enhance the capacity of citizens to hold public institutions accountable. Because I, the requestor, am a journalist, and I seek the information in order to disseminate it to the public, and because the information regards the safety, welfare, and legal rights of the general public, I request a fee waiver for this data under 950 CMR 32.07(2)(k). It is not for commercial benefit because I am a member of the nonprofit news media whose principal purpose is to access and disseminate information regarding the general public’s safety, welfare, and legal rights. To the extent you intend to assess any charges, please notify me to discuss first.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Stecklow

title: Dataset: 911 Call Data (City Of Riverside Public-safety Communications Center, Riverside, Ca, Usa)

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Dataset: 911 Call Data (City Of Riverside Public-safety Communications Center, Riverside, Ca, Usa)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

RAW Computer Aided Dispatch Data queried out of your emergency phone system on 911 calls for service from January 2014 to the most recent date data is collected. In CSV, TXT, or XML format, a machine-readable spreadsheet (not XLSX format). 

Here are the column headers which I am requesting:

Master Incident Number or Event Number – Unique numerical identifier of the call for service
Case Number – If an incident report was written, this is the file number, which can be joined to the incidents and arrests datasets
Call Date – Date the call for service was generated
Call Time – Time the call for service was generated
Source – How the call was generated from the public, or self-initiated by an officer
Priority – The priority level of the call response, with ‘P’ being the highest, followed in order numerically
Nature – The description of the call for service.
Address – The block number and street or intersection of the call for service.
Latitude/longitude - coordinates for call of service
X – Mapping coordinate of the call for service
Y – Mapping coordinate of the call for service
District – The patrol district where the call for service was located.
Beat – The patrol beat where the call for service was located, which is a sub-division of the district
Tract – The census tract where the incident occurred, based on 2010 census data
Disposition – How the call for service was closed
Cancelled – Whether the call for service was cancelled prior to officer arrival
Dispatch Date and Time - The exact date and time when the dispatcher sent the call to emergency responders, such as police, fire, or EMS
Entry Date and Time - The date and time when the call was initially logged into the 911 computer-aided dispatch (CAD) system
Received Date and Time - The date and time when the 911 call was first answered by the dispatch center
Enroute Date and Time - The date and time when the assigned responder (e.g., a patrol car, ambulance, or fire truck) began traveling to the incident location
On Scene Date and Time - The date and time when the responder arrived at the scene of the incident
Close Date and Time - The date and time when the incident or call was marked as completed or resolved in the CAD system
Dispatcher ID - A unique identifier for the dispatcher who handled and managed the 911 call. This may be used for tracking or auditing purposes

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Filed Requests

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Dataset: 911 Call Data (City Of Riverside Public-safety Communications Center, Riverside, Ca, Usa)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Upon review, additional data fields are necessary to fully interpret the records already requested and/or produced. I therefore request the following additional column headers, to the extent they exist in your CAD system, for the same date range (January 2014 to the most recent date data is collected), in CSV, TXT, or XML format:

* Unique Identifier – A unique numerical identifier for each call for service, if distinct from the master incident or event number
* Dispatcher ID(s) – Identifier(s) for all dispatchers who handled the call, if multiple
* Responder ID – A unique identifier for the responding unit(s) or team(s)
* Prime Unit – Identifier indicating the primary response unit
* Other Units – All additional responding unit identifiers
* Back-up Requested – Indicator or code showing whether back-up was requested
* Transport – Indicator (Y/N) of whether transport occurred
* Transport Start and End Times – If transport occurred
* Transport Destination Address – The address or facility to which transport occurred
* Program or Response Type – Any field identifying non-police, co-response, or alternative response teams (including behavioral health, crisis, or care-based units), if applicable

If any of the above fields are stored under different names, codes, or tables, I request the functional equivalent fields.

I also request any available data dictionary or codebook necessary to interpret these fields.

If you deny any portion of this supplemental request, please cite the specific statutory exemption relied upon and provide the applicable appeal procedures as required by law.

As before, these records are requested for non-commercial purposes and will be made available to the general public. Please inform me in advance of any fees associated with fulfilling this request.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Sincerely,
FR

Call Time – Time the call for service was generated 
Source – How the call was generated from the public, or self-initiated by an officer 
Priority – The priority level of the call response, with ‘P’ being the highest, followed in order numerically 
Nature – The description of the call for service. 
Address – The block number and street or intersection of the call for service. 
Latitude/longitude - coordinates for call of service 
X – Mapping coordinate of the call for service 
Y – Mapping coordinate of the call for service 
District – The patrol district where the call for service was located. 
Beat – The patrol beat where the call for service was located, which is a sub-division of the district 
Tract – The census tract where the incident occurred, based on 2010 census data 
Disposition – How the call for service was closed 
Cancelled – Whether the call for service was cancelled prior to officer arrival 
Dispatch Date and Time - The exact date and time when the dispatcher sent the call to emergency responders, such as police, fire, or EMS 
Entry Date and Time - The date and time when the call was initially logged into the 911 computer-aided dispatch (CAD) system 
Received Date and Time - The date and time when the 911 call was first answered by the dispatch center 
Enroute Date and Time - The date and time when the assigned responder (e.g., a patrol car, ambulance, or fire truck) began traveling to the incident location 
On Scene Date and Time - The date and time when the responder arrived at the scene of the incident 
Close Date and Time - The date and time when the incident or call was marked as completed or resolved in the CAD system 
Dispatcher ID - A unique identifier for the dispatcher who handled and managed the 911 call. This may be used for tracking or auditing purposes 

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Filed Requests 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2179813/ The request will be forwarded to appropriate department(s) for processing. Monitor request progress at the link below.  The Public Records Advocate will email you when the request is complete.  Thank you for using the Riverside Records Portal. Carmen Soto City Clerk’s Office 
3900 Main Street 
Riverside, CA 92522 
(951) 826-5557 CSoto@riversideca.gov (mailto:CSoto@riversideca.gov)

title: OLYMPIA SCHOOL DISTRICT - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: OLYMPIA SCHOOL DISTRICT - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
communications.communication:
January 12, 2025

via email to dcrawford@osd.wednet.edu

OLYMPIA SCHOOL DISTRICT - JLARC (2024) Agency Costs Fulfilling Public Records Requests Including Litigation for the year 2024
 
To whom it may concern,

RCW 40.14.026(5)

“To improve best practices for dissemination of public records, each agency with actual staff and legal costs associated with fulfilling public records requests of at least one hundred thousand dollars during the prior fiscal year must… report to the joint legislative audit and review committee by July 1st of each subsequent year the following metrics, measured over the preceding year:

RCW 40.14.026(5)(l)

(l) The estimated costs incurred by the agency in fulfilling records requests, including costs for staff compensation and legal review, and a measure of the average cost per request;

RCW 40.14.026(5)(o)

(o) The costs incurred by the agency with managing and retaining records, including staff compensation and purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests;

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

1. Please provide all "Public Records" (as defined by WAC 44-14-03001) detailing costs incurred by your agency in fulfilling records requests, including staff compensation, legal review, and any public records related litigation costs and/or legal settlements for the year 2024 and complete copies of all records request realted fee payments paid to your agency in 2024.

Responsive public records should include but are not limited to:

Supplies and services external services (e.g., printing services, large format printing) Mailing costs, supplies (CDs, DVDs, USB sticks, etc.) Staff compensation and benefit records, copies of payments of Public Records Fees Collected, Software licensing, public records portal and database software licensing and costs, purchases of equipment, hardware, software, and services to manage and retain public records or otherwise assist in the fulfillment of public records requests, professional services Agency staff costs, copies of billing for all Legal costs – including copies of all litigation Legal settlements related to public records requests litigation of any kind and copies of costs for staff time associated with invoicing and collection.

RECORDS INSTALLMENTS

If production of responsive records will be completed in multiple installments, please begin by producing records in the numerical order requested by subject matter and year. The most recent public records should be produced first.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

The use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA or NEXTREQUEST) for communication and production of records in response to a public records request is optional for the requestor in the State of Washington. Respectfully we decline to use any 3rd party "portal" system, specifically GOVQA and NEXTREQUEST. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment, or via no password, no registration internet cloud-based download link.

Please do not direct or invite us to use, register for, or communicate with your agency via any 3rd party portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other commercial 3rd party records portal service.

Constructive Notice: Any and all communication(s) received on behalf of your agency in reference to this Public Records Request (RCW 42.45) from any unauthorized for-profit 3rd party company doing business outside the State of Washington will be the subject of a new public records request to your agency as to the origin and purpose of the communication as well as the identity of the sender of the communication.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format. Unless the records exist IN PAPER FORM ONLY, DO NOT instead create new records by printing native stored electronic files, then scanning and re-printing these newly scanned prints only to reproduce them in again in electronic production.

EMAIL RECORDS

Please provide any and all email records in NATIVE .pst electronic format.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION - FAMILY EDUCATIONAL RIGHTS AND PRIVACY ACT (FERPA)

Take caution with the broad application of redaction and withholding of identified public records claiming "global FERPA" exemptions. When an agency claims an exemption for an entire record or portion of one, it must inform the requestor of the statutory exemption and provide a brief explanation of how the exemption applies to the record or portion withheld. RCW 42.17.310(4)/42.56.210(3). The brief explanation should cite the statute the agency claims grant an exemption from disclosure. The brief explanation should provide enough information for a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the claimed exemption is proper. Global, nonspecific claims of exemption such as "FERPA" are insufficient. One way to properly provide a brief explanation of the withheld record or redaction is for the agency to provide a withholding index. It identifies the type of record, its date and number of pages, and the author or recipient of the record (unless their identity is exempt). The withholding index should allow a requestor to make a threshold determination of whether the agency has properly invoked the exemption. There are several exceptions to the FERPA exemption and any agency silently withholding large swaths of public records citing "FERPA!" without providing the original identified record, properly redacted, or if withheld in its entirety, providing a record description and page count or record length, will be challenged in accordance with RCW 42.56.550 if a reasonably detailed withholding index or exemption log is not included.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

title: Amazon inland empire (San Bernardino City Clerk)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Amazon inland empire (San Bernardino City Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that Amazon has been active in the Inland Empire and among Inland Empire public agencies: https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2023-12-05/leaked-document-offers-glimpse-into-how-amazon-amasses-influence-in-the-inland-empire

https://twitter.com/LorenaSGonzalez/status/1732047860701782381/photo/4

Therefore, I hereby request the following records:

1) All presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other information presented to the city/agency by Amazon 

2) A copy of any incident reports relating to Amazon, including attachments and media.

3) Any emails between the city/district and Amazon employees, including attachments and media. Please limit search to between Jan 1, 2023 and the time this request is processed

4) Any grants, gifts, contracts, between this agency and Amazon

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

title: Public Records Request: SafePointe

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request: SafePointe
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, licenses, MOUs, MOAs, data agreements, letters of intent, State of Work documents, Scope of Work documents, and other agreement documents with SafePointe that were active between 1/1/2018 and 8/25/2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Cook County Public Defender FOIA Request Records 1.1.24-12.17.25
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show the following information for all FOIA requests sent to your office from 1/1/2024 through the present date: 
1. records requested, 2. status of request (completed, denied, partially denied) 3. date of request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Candice Garcia

title: Drone as First Responder program contract and details

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Drone as First Responder program contract and details
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of all Requests for Proposal (or equivalent solicitations) and vendor bids and supplemental materials associated with this agency’s procurement of devices and services related to the establishment and execution of a Drone-as-First-Responder (DFR) program

2. A copy of this agency’s  contract (as well as all amendments, attachments, and exhibits) for devices and services used in its DFR program

3. Copies of all policies, directives, guidelines, and procedures governing this agency’s use of drones and the execution of operations under its DFR program, including documentation describing the device models and technical specifications of the devices used and any policies regarding the “curtilage” of a person’s property

4. A copy of all data sharing agreements and lists of other entities with which this agency shares or receives information. This includes the list of all agencies that receive notifications based on this agency’s list of license plates and vehicles of interest (often referred to as a “hot list”) and the list of all agencies that have access to all vehicle scans conducted by this agency’s devices

5. A copy of all manuals and operational references for this agency’s use of drones and the implementation and use of the DFR program. This includes all policies, procedures, and manuals related to the following elements of the execution of the drone and DFR program: 
a. appropriate deployment and use of the drone or drones; 
b. collection of camera footage, audio, and other data;
c. retention of footage, audio, and other data;
d. sharing of footage, audio, and other data, including via third-party networks and across jurisdictions; 
e. appropriate positioning of drone cameras and other payloads during flights;
f. the appropriate protection of collected, stored, and shared audio, footage, and other data
g. the policies and mechanisms used for auditing drone and DFR use, including appropriate investigatory use and access
h. the policies and mechanisms of consequences of unauthorized and inappropriate access to the drone or DFR systems

6. All materials sufficient to show the complete list of features and integration capabilities associated with the drone or DFR programs, including all materials related to device or DFR program integration with automated license plate readers (ALPRs), gunshot detection, video analytics, AI-enabled analysis, and other datasets, surveillance tools, and analytical systems.

7. All communications between a representative of this agency and a representative of the private entity from which this agency has procured DFR program devices and services for the period from January 1, 2025 through the current date.

8. A copy of the drone flight log for the period from January 1, 2025, through September 22, 2025 including the date and time of the flight, the investigatory purpose of the flight, the drone operator, and any other segregable information

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Vivien Fleck
Please submit your request via our online portal through Sparkspolice.com. We cannot complete your request through fax.

communications.subject: Public Records Request 20253368
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Your public records request 20253368 is complete. You will receive a Sharebase link with the email portion of the request. You will receive policies, contractual information, and quotes from the PRR 20253368 which was originally submitted in September 2025. There are no data sharing agreements. Manuals and operational references are Skydio's documents and are on Skydio's website. Please also note the following information:

As required by NRS 239.0107(2)(d), please see the following notification(s).  Some records and/or information were withheld and/or redacted as confidential and/or privileged records for the following reasons.

Attorney-Client Privilege. See NRS 49.095; Seibel v. Eighth Jud. Dist. Ct. in & for Cnty. of Clark, 138 Nev. Adv. Op. 73, 520 P.3d 350 (2022); Wynn Resorts, Ltd. v. Eighth Jud. Dist. Ct. in & for Cnty. of Clark, 133 Nev. 369 (2017); United States v. Zolin, 491 U.S. 554 (1989)

Homeland Security & Confidential Tactical Operations. See NRS 239C.210 ("A document, record or other item of information...that is prepared and maintain for the purpose of preventing or responding to an act of terrorism is confidential...."); see also State of Nevada Executive Order 2020-01, Order Declaring Certain Public Safety Documents Confidential and Not Subject to Subpoena, Discovery, or Inspection by the General Public.

Individual Nontrivial Privacy Interest. See Clark Cnty. Sch. Dist. v. Las Vegas Rev.-J., 134 Nev. 700 (2018); Las Vegas Metro. Police Dep't v. Las Vegas Rev.-J., 136 Nev. 733 (2020); Cameranesi v. United States Dep't of Def., 856 F.3d 626 (9th Cir. 2017); Donrey of Nevada, Inc. v. Bradshaw, 106 Nev. 630 (1990); see also FOIA Exemption 6 (5 U.S.C.A. § 552(b)(6)).

Proprietary Information. See NRS 332.061; NRS 333.333; NRS 338.1727; NRS Chapter 603.

If you have trouble accessing the documents or require anything further, please feel free to contact me back.

Thank you,

Kristin Lindquist
Police Records Supervisor
(775) 353-2241 ext. 5562
[Description: Description: Description: Description: Description: 60_60_90]

Good day, 
 
Your request: 20253368 - DRONE AS FIRST RESPONDER PROGRAM CONTRACT AND DETAILS is now completed. 
 
 The record(s) you have been provided do not contain any documentation from other agencies or any confidential information.  Sparks Police Department  is required to redact or remove all personal identifying information (NRS 603A.040), proprietary information (NRS 333.335), information from the National Crime Information Center (28 CFR § 50.12(b); USC 28 § 534(f)(1); CJIS Security Policy Section 4.2.3), information about ongoing criminal investigations (NRS 199.520; Donrey of Nevada v. Bradshaw, 106 Nev. 630, 798 P.2d 144 (1990) ), information about victims of crimes (Nevada Constitution, Article 1, Section 23; NRS 178.5691); and information relating to individuals’ private interests such that disclosure to the public would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of privacy (Clark Cnty. Sch. Dist. v. Las Vegas Review-Journal, 134 Nev. 700, 429 P.3d 313 (2018)). 
 
 If your request contained any of the above information, it has been redacted or removed as required by law. 
 
Electronic records are available here for the next 60 days: 
https://app.sharebase.com/#/folder/134711/share/242-kIALu0mtcC9TEUBgiTMrgdmUC--o 
 
If you receive “Invalid Source” when attempting to view a document, download the document and open it in a separate window.

Best regards.

title: Open Records Request for ALPR Documents - Lawrence Co Indiana

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Open Records Request for ALPR Documents - Lawrence Co Indiana
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to Indiana’s Access to Public Records Act (IC 5-14-3), I respectfully request a copy of the following records held by your agency related to the use of automated license plate readers (ALPRs) for the period of January 1, 2022, to December 9, 2025. To ensure compliance with IC 5-14-3-3, I request that these records be provided in PDF format, where available, to facilitate public access and minimize costs. If PDF format is unavailable, paper records are acceptable. If any portion of this request is denied or redacted, please provide a written explanation citing the specific statutory exemption under IC 5-14-3-4 and any applicable case law, as required by IC 5-14-3-9.

Please provide copies of the following records:

1. Contracts with ALPR Vendors: All contracts, agreements, memoranda of understanding, or other documents between your agency and any company providing ALPR technology or services, including but not limited to Flock Safety, Vigilant Solutions, Rekor Systems, or any other ALPR vendor. This includes any amendments, renewals, or extensions of such contracts executed or effective between January 1, 2022, and December 9, 2025.

2. Policies on ALPR Data Access: All policies, procedure manuals, training materials, or other documentation, effective or revised between January 1, 2022, and December 9, 2025, that describe: a. Who within your agency (e.g., specific roles, ranks, or units) is authorized to search or access license plate data collected by any ALPR vendor, regardless of whether the data is stored by the vendor or the Monroe County Sheriff’s Office. b. The process for granting, revoking, or monitoring such access.

3. Policies on ALPR Searches and Alerts: All policies, procedure manuals, or other documentation, effective or revised between January 1, 2022, and December 9, 2025, that describe: a. The circumstances under which a license plate may be searched in ALPR data, including any criteria, approvals, or justifications required. b. The circumstances under which an alert or notification may be set for a specific license plate, including any criteria, approvals, or justifications required.

4. Policies on ALPR Search Logs and Audits: All policies, procedure manuals, or other documentation, effective or revised between January 1, 2022, and December 9, 2025, that describe: a. The maintenance of logs recording who searches ALPR data, when, and the stated reason or purpose for each search. b. The process, frequency, and criteria for auditing such logs to ensure compliance with your agency's policies or state/federal law, including any reports or documentation summarizing audit procedures.

If any records are maintained in a database or electronic system, I request an export of the relevant data in a machine-readable format (e.g., CSV, Excel) pursuant to IC 5-14-3-3(g), converted to PDF for delivery. If any responsive records are withheld or redacted, please provide a detailed log describing each withheld or redacted record, including the record’s title, date, and the specific legal basis for withholding or redaction.

I am willing to pay reasonable fees for copying or searching records, as permitted under IC 5-14-3-8, up to a maximum of $100. Please notify me in advance if fees are expected to exceed this amount. If a fee waiver is available due to the public interest in understanding your agency’s use of ALPR technology for transparency and accountability, I respectfully request consideration under IC 5-14-3-8(e). The requested information is sought for non-commercial purposes.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records pertaining to Wolverine Tube Inc. located at 30500 Railroad Street in Ardmore, Tennessee (Division of Remediation Site ID numbers 28502 and 28511). The facility was listed on the Voluntary Cleanup Program Inventory (VCP), State Remediation Program List (SRP), and Toxics Release Inventory System (TRIS) databases. The facility may be listed under the name Universal Oil or National Copper. Alternate addresses may include 30498 and 40494 Railroad Street. For the facility's VCP/SRP participation, please include the following record types, if available: initial incident reports, initial site investigations, subsequent site investigations (may be called a "further site investigation" or similar), quarterly groundwater monitoring reports, remedial action plans, remedial action completion reports,  and site closure/no further action (NFA) documentation. As it pertains to the TRIS listing, please include the facility's Tier II reports, Form Rs, and material safety data sheets (MSDS). TRI ID 38449WLVRNRAILR.

All Scheduled meetings past and future where Monica Holy's disposition was or will be discussed. Please be certain to include all communications "addressed to" and "sent from" at least the following current and/or former employees of the The School District of Clayton and The Parkway School District: Kelly Sollberger, Nisha Patel, Carolyn Day, Mariana Wood, Kelly Goughenour, Isabella Frederick, Michael Baugus, Tony Arnold, David Duckworth, Scott Wilkerson, Katie Henderson, Jeff Lackey, Daniel Henderson, and Jamie Jordan.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Parkway School District Employment Procedures (Parkway Schools)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am writing to formally appeal the Parkway School District’s response to my Missouri Sunshine Law request dated December 15, 2025, issued pursuant to Chapter 610, RSMo.

In its response, Parkway states that it searched for responsive records and determined that none are subject to public disclosure, asserting that all responsive records constitute confidential personnel records closed under §§610.021(13) and (14), RSMo. This blanket denial is not consistent with the Missouri Sunshine Law and does not satisfy Parkway’s statutory obligations for the reasons outlined below.

1. Blanket Closure of All Responsive Records Is Improper Under Chapter 610
The Sunshine Law does not permit a public governmental body to categorically close all records merely because they tangentially involve a person or employment-related subject matter. Sections 610.021(13) and (14) apply only to specific, narrowly defined categories of personnel information. Communications that involve hiring processes, inter-district communications, meeting scheduling, administrative discussions, or disposition-related decisions are not automatically personnel records, nor are they presumptively closed.

Missouri courts have repeatedly held that the Sunshine Law must be construed liberally in favor of openness, and exemptions must be narrowly applied. Parkway’s response fails to do so.

2. Failure to Segregate Open and Closed Records
Even where a portion of a record may be closed, §610.024, RSMo requires the district to release all reasonably segregable, non-exempt portions of responsive records. Parkway’s response does not indicate that any effort was made to segregate open content from allegedly closed content, nor does it identify which portions of records are claimed to be exempt.

A blanket refusal to produce any portion of any responsive record violates the segregation requirement of the Sunshine Law.

3. Failure to Provide a Record-Specific Exemption Explanation
When records are withheld, the custodian must identify the specific statutory exemption relied upon and explain how it applies to the withheld records. Parkway’s generalized reference to §§610.021(13) and (14), without identifying the nature of the records withheld or how each exemption applies, is insufficient under §610.023, RSMo.

At a minimum, Parkway must provide:

A description of the categories of records withheld;

The specific statutory exemption applied to each category; and

Confirmation that all non-exempt portions have been released.

4. Records Requested Are Not Limited to “Personnel Records”
My request explicitly includes:

Emails, texts, and communications between Parkway and Clayton personnel;

Communications on personal devices used for public business;

Meeting schedules, calendars, and related documentation;

Discussions regarding hiring, redistricting, and disposition decisions.

Many of these records concern administrative actions, inter-district communications, and hiring processes, which are public records under Chapter 610 and do not fall within personnel exemptions simply because they reference an individual.

5. Reasonable Search and Documentation
While Parkway states that it conducted a search, it provides no description of the scope of that search, including:

Which custodians were searched;

Whether text messages and personal devices were included;

Whether calendars and meeting records were reviewed.

The Sunshine Law requires a reasonable, good-faith search for responsive records. Parkway’s response does not demonstrate compliance with this requirement.

Requested Cure
I respectfully request that Parkway School District promptly cure these deficiencies by:

Conducting and documenting a reasonable, good-faith search for all responsive records, including texts, calendars, and communications on personal devices used for public business;

Producing all responsive, non-exempt records;

Releasing all reasonably segregable portions of records that may contain both open and closed content;

Providing a detailed explanation identifying the specific statutory exemption applied to any records or portions thereof withheld; and

Confirming whether any meetings—formal or informal—were held or scheduled in which my disposition or hiring was discussed, and producing all related records.

If Parkway continues to deny access to the requested records in whole or in part, please consider this letter a request for a written explanation sufficient to permit review under §610.027, RSMo.

This request is made for non-commercial purposes, and the records will be made available to the general public. I continue to request electronic production and advance notice of any fees.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this appeal. I look forward to Parkway’s good-faith compliance with the Missouri Sunshine Law.

Sincerely,
Dr. Monica Holy

title: SC - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: SC - Historical Fishing and Hunting License and Tag Fees
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am a researcher interested in fishing and hunting license prices. I would like to obtain annual data on the yearly recreational fishing and hunting license and tag price data from 1990 to present. Specifically, I would like records showing the fees for the following licenses and tags for both residents and nonresidents (where applicable) from 1/1/1990 to 1/12/26 (listed annually, i.e., one fee per license/tag per year from 1990 to 2026). Please also include the agent fee, where applicable. Please provide fees pertaining to adults. In cases of reciprocal pricing agreements with other states, please provide both the special reciprocal prices to residents of those states and the general price to residents of all states without a reciprocal pricing agreement, where necessary.

Freshwater Fishing License - Annual and 14 day
Saltwater Fishing License - Annual and 14 day (7 day and 1 day for nonresidents)
State Hunting License - Annual, 10 Day, 3 Day (10 and 3 day for nonresidents only)
Big Game Permit - annual 
Bear Tag
 Alligator Hunting Fee
Unrestricted Antlered (Buck) Deer Tags (nonresidents)
Turkey Tags
Turtle Permit

If data is not available back to 1990 for one or more of the specified license or tag prices, please provide data from the oldest year on record to present. To what extent license or tag names might have changed, please match to the most similar license or tag, if possible, for continuation purposes. If possible, please provide the data in a table. Thank you for your help.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christian Hachtman

title: HS Curricula

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: HS Curricula
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that this school district has been subject to curricula and book challenges
Therefore, I request the following: 

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance related to Stamped: Racism, Antiracism, and You by Ibram Kendi,  approved materials lists, and book bans. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discuss book bans and "approved lists" B) any other document that has been used to help explain book bans and acceptable curricula, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) about, pertaining to, or mentioning Stamped: Racism, Antiracism, and You by Ibram Kendi,  approved materials lists, and book bans


Please perform this search for records between Jan 1, 2022 and the time this request is processed. This request is not for commercial purposes and will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent, journalist-owned news site (www.404media.co).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

title: Records request Anduril Arsenal-1 sewer and water lines/ Inkstick Media

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Records request Anduril Arsenal-1 sewer and water lines/ Inkstick Media
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Under the Ohio Open Records Law, §149.43 et seq., I hereby request the following records:

Copies of records submitted by the Verdantas civil engineering firm regarding utilities serving the Arsenal-1 Hyperscale Manufacturing Facility in Pickaway County. Specifically, I am seeking all applications and construction plans for an extension of a water line and sanitary/sewer systems to serve the Anduril plant, including a proposed timeline for construction.

At a Madison Township Trustees zoning hearing in December, Amanda Spencer, the director of land development at Verdantas, described the planned utilities, saying: “As far as utilities go, we are planning an extension of a water line that will run along the roadway. It is tied in to an existing water line that was constructed with previous phases of development. It will head north on Airbase road, and it will head east on Airbase road. Eventually, it will continue south on Walnut Creek Pike and end at the southeast corner of the development. The sanitary will tie into a long planned sanitary extension by the City of Columbus that will be constructed on the south side of Airbase road, right along the top of this development.”

I first submitted this request to the Pickaway County Engineer, whose office told me to direct records requests related to water lines serving the plant to the Earnhart Hill Regional Water & Sewer District.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I would request a prompt response to this request.  If you expect a significant delay in responding to or in fulfilling this request, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies of the requested records.

Sincerely,

Taylor Barnes, Inkstick Media

These plans are in draft form and are not to be used for bidding or construction.
